poem:
An Alpine Song  

In the symphony of ascent,  
a mountain breathes,  
clean and bold,  
Finnish winds weaving  
through pine-tangle and sky-span.   
Each note,  
a step on granite dreams,  
not sullen nor slow.  
Instead, a brisk cadence  
in the morning's brisk call,  
where sound becomes air,  
and grandeur echoes  
through our own quiet passage.
